name: Danubius Hotel Flamenco - Budapest

reviews.text: I stayed here as part of a tour and as with most hotels that cater to tours, this was not in a convenient location and had no amenities. There was no wireless although they advertised to having it and I took a 10 minute walk in all directions and found maybe 2 places to eat. However, if you lack a sense of direction like I do, if you walk straight on the same road, you will reach Central Market Hall and the tourisy pedestrian streets. There was a weird smell in the washroom too. I did manage to grab nearby wifi signals from my room and watch consecutive 10 minute movie previews on the television.
reviews.title: Poor location and average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel was the epitome of a 4-Star Hotel. There was an excellent workout area - 2 rooms with weights, fully staffed circuit exercise machines, and an aerobics room. There was a sauna and small inside swimming pool, and the morning buffet breakfast was very good with a wide variety of choices. If you want a good meal for the price, the lobby restaurant by the Gift Shop served excellent food with knowledgable staff and English speaking, which helped for our questions. The waiter suggested a local beer on draft (Dreher), and it turned out to have a nice full-bodied taste. Public transport was very close by, but it you don;t mind walking a little, you can walk to most anything you care to find - a local marketplace, boat trips on the Danube, restaurants, etc...
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel with wonderful staff and amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights on completion of our cycle tour and the hotel was booked by the tour company. It was comfortable enough but nothing special. Unfortunately not very central. The city is split into the Budda side of the river and the Pest. I think we were on the wrong side. We ate in the restaurant/ coffee shop each night as there was nothing appealing close by and we didn't feel like going back into town having been out all day. Generally o.k. The Greek Salad was very good. Unfortunately wifi is not free.
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.text: Though it doesn't have the Spanish touch you might expect by the name, the Flamenco was really up to my expectations based on some previous information. I found the location excellent if you have lots of things to deal with in Budapest, everything is within easy reach, and yet you have a peaceful, green area if you look out the window in the morning. Also the service staff was very friendly and apparently hard-working. Breakfast had a great choice.
reviews.title: Perfect choice for a business stay

reviews.text: A great choice if you want to stay in Buda. It's a nice clean, spacious hotel. The swimming pool is a little small for such a large hotel & a bit on the cool side but nice to have all the same. Breakfast had a good selection of cold items and some hot ones too. Liked the french toast! You could even eat outside on a terrace if you wanted to.
reviews.title: Definitely gets a thumbs up!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the airport, take 200E bus to Kipest, then use the Metro (red line 3) and then Tram number 41 or 49 will take you direct to the hotel (only 5 minutes walk) Total time is 50 minutes. It is good to buy a 3, 5 or a week travel pass. Friendly staff, clean hotel with great gym. Fantastic breakfast range.
reviews.title: Great hotel - highly recommended.

reviews.title: Just another boring hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To start i will say we only paid £130 for four nights for the two of us in total for B&B so lets be fair....£16 a night each - i wasn't expecting the Hilton. I will however say that Thompson rated this as 4T's which is a bit much. It's an average 3* hotel at best. We ate out every night so dinner wasn't an issue. They tried to deny us breakfast on our second morning but apologised straight away when they realised they were wrong. We never left a tip for the room cleaners as the only thing they did was make our bed (which we could have done). They didn't even empty our glasses of water from our bedside for the 4 nights we were there, or put into the bin any empty shampoo packets mistakenly left in the bathroom. We were on the 3rd floor and the first night was very noisy in the corridor. The walls are very thin and i'm pleased i took earplugs. That said, the staff were helpful when asked anything and they didn't charge us for a phone call when i realised i'd booked our return taxi for the wrong time to the airport. The spa facilities are fine and the pool was ample seeing as i didn't intend to spend too long in the hotel. it really was for us just a base for putting our heads down. that said i don't do hostels so wouldn't have wanted anything run down. We used Airport Transfers Budapest (ATB) who were brilliant and not too expensive. Driver apologised for being late when in fact we'd touched down early. They then turned up two hours early at our urgent request when i'd booked the wrong departure time. Couldn't recommend them enough. Be careful when using the trams. We didn't know how to validate our tickets and tried watching the locals but no-one seemed to do theirs. When the ticket inspectors got on, we were booted off the tram for fare dodging and fined £20 each (12,000HUF in total). Not really fair on a tourist who intentionally purchased a ticket but just didn't know how to validate it. That was our only bad point. Recommend you learn some basic words. Thank You got us big smiles where ever we went. Recommend the Orange Hop On Hop Off bus tour - 5,000HUF gets you a 24hr bus pass, 2 boat trips valid for a year, 1 beer, and 1 Goulash. 1 boat trip alone was worth 2,100 HUF's. overall a good city to do a four day visit to.
reviews.title: cheap, local, basic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I came to the Flemenco to accompany my husband on a business trip. I had read the reviews so didn't have huge expectations. However it's pretty good at what it does. An easy tram ride to the centre, though it's not that far to walk, made for easy sightseeing. The hotel is a little stale, rather dated, but mostly OK so if being seen in the newest and latest isn't important to you then you'll be fine. Everything works, beds are fine, there's plenty water from the shower, the breakfast is perfectly acceptable. We were brought extra pillows without hesitation. My main complaint was only having a single dispenser of liquid soap as the 'supplied' toiletries. These days, when we all fly hand luggage, it's nice to have some little bottles of shampoo and body lotion etc in the room.. but my kind husband procured some little bottles of shampoo from a cleaner or reception or someone, so they are available - just ask. I didn't hear a single whinge about the conference facilities from my husband, so I guess all was good there. Certainly the 'conference' food was of a good standard. So all in all, better than I had expected and nothing really to complain about. (A bigger pool would be good, but hey..). And enjoy Budapest - it's a very fine place to spend a few days.
reviews.title: Better than you might think..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Flamenco quite a few times over the last ten years but have decided after our last visit never to stay there again. We liked it because of the area if was in, away from the crowds, yet easy to get anywhere with the excellent transport services. Now they have taken the restaurant away and left you with just the coffee shop which they now use as the restaurant. There are no coffee and tea facilities in the room, the bath bath is very short, the swimming pool is cold and really the rooms need modernising. The people on the receiption are very nice, especially Geregly Kollai who went out off his way to help in any way possible. We looked at several other hotels this time and decided it did not compare very well any more. Its okay if you find a very cheap rate but don't bother with otherwise.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: The value of the hotel very much depends on the price you pay for it. I wouldnt say that paying more then 50 eur is worth the place and the service. Rooms are relatively small, there are smoking rooms on the same floor and you can smell those sometimes. There is a small park in front with a restaurant in it: i dont recomend it since the food is not good at all. There is a shopping center relatively close, only 6-7 min walking, worh gong if you plan to shop for shoes and clothes in Budapest.
reviews.title: OK hotel. Not clise to the center though

reviews.text: Overall, it is an affordable hotel with good service. The room service and restaurant eals were very good. The front desk was very helpful. The rooms are a bit old but they have done a good job updating the hotel with Wi-Fi and TV programs. The best feature was service though.
reviews.title: Very good service

reviews.text: Spent 3 nights in this place last week when weather was around 25 to 30°C.
reviews.title: Old, poor service, need urgent refurbishment

reviews.title: Cheap but not so attractive...

reviews.text: The hotel in itself is indicated as 4 stars, but is more like 2 stars.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked and paid this hotel online but the hotel had no record of the payment, only the booking. The staff at reception was rude, ignored us eventhough there was no other guests waiting at the reception desk. At checkout it took us quite a while to convince them that our stay had already been paid for at the time of the booking, which was rather frustrating. The hotel is not in the city centre, but in a nice area of Budapest. It is close to a small lake and surrounding park, local restaurants, shops, and 3 minutes walk from a tramstop. The building itself is form the 70ies and has not been modernised - the walls and corridors are bare, in need of painting, the furniture is old and uncomfortable, no airconditioning in the rooms. The only polite and professional staffmember was the barman in the hotel lobby - he was knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. The hotel is called a 'thermal hotel' but there is only one regular pool, no thermal water or bath. The breakfast was plentiful, a nice variety with international and typical hungarian dishes that were replenished often. I would go back again for brekkie there but not to stay at the hotel.
reviews.title: Not impressed

description: The hotel is situated in a green park only 15 minutes from the city center of Budapest. We await our guests with 355 guest rooms, a nice restaurant with vegetarian specialties and daily menus. If you prefer vibrant activity to culinary delights you can visit our fitness center free of charge during your stay.
